Jennifer Pouplin PhD Candidate at Purdue University, under the supervision of Dr. David A. Minton

My Expertise

I am a PhD candidate in Astrodynamics and Space Applications at Purdue University. As part of my dissertation work, I am applying my skills in Planetary Sciences, by modeling the orbital evolution of planetary rings and satellites systems, such as the hypothesized ancient martian ring system, or the contemporary ring system around Chariklo.

Code development

I used Swifter, a N-body dynamics code, and helped develop Swiftest!

Coding Languages

My main development languages are Fortran and Python, but I have used Matlab, C, and more.

Tools

I have used many tools, such as Git, ifort/gfortran, OpenMP, Jupyter Notebooks, GNUPlot, Panda dataframes!
